intro: Wahlenbergia stricta subsp. alterna, commonly known as the narrowleaf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal areas. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand salt spray and sandy conditions.
